definitionGroups.group: An electronic device for detecting sound, vibration, etc., such as one fitted to an electric guitar or record player.

entries.meaning: In a record player, an electromagnetic component that converts the needle vibrations into an electrical signal.
Electromagnetic coil receiver of metal string oscillations.

examples: Franklin is beside himself, revving up the engine in the pickup.

entries.meaning: (usually attributive) Impromptu or ad hoc, especially of sports games and teams made up of randomly selected players.
examples: Rather than join a basketball league, James decided to play pickup.
At lunch we had a game of pickup hockey.

entries.meaning: An instance of approaching someone and engaging in romantic flirtation and courting with the intent to pursue romance, a date, or a sexual encounter.
examples: Hey, thanks for the drink, but if this is a pickup, I'm not interested.
Coordinate terms: pick-up line, pick-up joint, pickup artist

entries.meaning: A person successfully approached in this manner for romance or sex.
examples: Audball's latest pickup didn't seem to care where they were, or anything at all about alimony, palimony, or child support  […]

entries.meaning: (sports) In various games, the fielding or hitting of a ball just after it strikes the ground.
(video games) An item that can be picked up by the player, conferring some benefit or effect; a power-up.
examples: Every step of the way you come across absolutely loads of aliens, pick-ups and new and weird obstacles to overcome.

entries.meaning: (US, Canada, politics) The act of a challenging party or candidate winning an electoral district held by an incumbent party or candidate.
examples: The returns from the election show Apple Party candidate Jane Doe has made a pickup in the district of City West defeating Orange Party Incumbent Joe Smith

entries.meaning: The act of answering a telephone.
(film) A relatively minor shot filmed or recorded after the fact to augment previous footage.
The act of collecting and taking away something or someone, usually in a vehicle.
(uncountable) A time during which passengers, such as school children, are picked up.
(uncountable) The rate at which a motor vehicle picks up speed.
examples: The Willys-Overland won't be the fastest car on the road or have the best pickup, but it will have a top speed of eighty miles per hour, and its makers are confident that no car in its class will excel it in economy of fuel and upkeep.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The condition of being picked up, or taken up; adoption by some entity.
examples: Newsweek gave it a big write-up, as did many trade journals, including, [sic] Editor and Publisher. And our articles get pickup as far west as the Tombstone Epitaph in Arizona.
